intro: Ardisia willisii, commonly known as the Willison's beautyberry, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes evergreen shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in the spring. Following flowering, it produces bright purple berries that are a striking feature of the plant. These berries are not only ornamental but also serve as a food source for various bird species.
